text: The Oklahoma City bombing was a terrorist attack on April 19, 1995 on the U.S. government. The Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, United States, was attacked by Timothy McVeigh. The truck bombing destroyed much of the building. As a result, it had to be torn down. McVeigh and Terry Nichols exploded a truck bomb, killing 168 people and hurting 850 people. It was the most deadly terrorist attack in the US until the September 11 attacks six years later. The bombing caused $652 million in damage to the building and the nearby area. == References == == Other websites == Category:1995 in the United States Category:1990s building bombings Category:1990s murders in the United States Category:20th century in Oklahoma Category:April 1995 events Category:Building bombings in the United States Category:Car and truck bombings in the 1990s Category:Mass murder in the 1990s Category:Massacres in the United States Category:Murder in 1995 Bombing Category:Terrorist incidents in the 1990s Category:Nationalist terrorism
title: Oklahoma City bombing
